roleset.name: to save or rescue

example.name: passive
example.text: Ms. Johnson tells them that , if [the appliances]-1 ca n't be salvaged [*-1] , their policy covers the replacement cost .

example.name: transitive
example.text: Noting that Sweden-2 wound up [*-2]-1 wasting state subsidies of about 35 billion Swedish kronor ( $ 5.47 billion [*U*] ) during the 1970s in a vain attempt [*]-1 to salvage its shipbuilding industry , one analyst suggested that Mr. Suominen may have decided [*-3] to cut Finland 's losses once and for all .

example.name: all arguments
example.text: Majority Whip William Gray owes a political debt to Southern agriculture lawmakers for his rise in the House , and [the Philadelphia Democrat]-1 used his position in the conference [*-1] to salvage the exemption from a total ban .

roleset.note: Member of Vncls steal-10.5. Updated by Julia, 11/2010.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'salvage' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.
